I'm not going to get into a big discussion of the merits of TestNG on
the J=
Unit list... so you'll just need to do some research into that on
your own,=
 or pose that question on the TestNG list. My group uses both
tools dependi=
ng on the project and our specific needs so I honestly
can't tell you to us=
e one vs the other. ;-)

As for Continuum... It comes from the same team wo=
rking on the Maven
build tool and is a very nice CI server. It is newer tha=
n
CruiseControl but there are a number of people using it and working on
it=
 etc and the user list is rather active. They are working on v1.1
with a la=
rge number of new features etc so its taking some time.

As you mentioned, =
CruiseControl and Anthill are two other CI servers.
Most people I know run =
CruiseControl; I actually don't know anyone
personally who runs Anthill, bu=
t that doesn't mean much. I would take
a look at the various CI server mail=
ing lists, current/planned feature
lists, SCM check-ins and bug trackers to=
 get a feel for which one is
the best fit for your team.

Wayne

On 3/8/07,=
 Niklas Saers <niklassaers@...> wrote:
> Thanks guys for your many an=
swers. I have a couple of questions
> regarding your suggestions:
>
> C=E9d=
eric and Wayne: TestNG: how mature / well used is this compared to
> JUnit?=
 I've been using JUnit in a few projects before and see that
> lots of peop=
le use it. I've heared about TestNG before and when
> researching my ignore=
 problems I saw it and thought that its
> different parameters for @Test lo=
oked intriguing. Does JUnit do stuff
> that TestNG doesn't that I should kn=
ow that I'm sacrificing should I
> switch to TestNG?
>
> Continuum 1.0.3 is=
 considered a preview release from its
> documentation and was released a y=
ear ago. This tells me that it is
> not stable and well-tried and probably =
hasn't a big community
> submitting bugs and coming with feature requests. =
This of course is
> countered by 79 commits last month. :-) What is the sta=
te of Continuum?
>
> How do CruiseControl, Continuum and Anthill compare to=
 one-another?
> Thanks Wayne for these pointers, it all looks like a much b=
etter deal
> than Cron. :-)
>
> Cheers
>
> 	Nik
